招.definition: to recruit; to provoke; to beckon; to incur; to infect; contagious; a move (chess); a maneuver; device; trick; to confess

招兵買馬.definition: lit. to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); fig. to raise an army; to recruit new staff

招呼.definition: to call out to; to greet; to say hello to; to inform; to take care of; to take care that one does not

招商.definition: to seek investment or funding; investment promotion

招嫖.definition: (of a sex worker) to solicit customers

招安.definition: to enlist enemy or rebel soldiers by offering amnesty

招待.definition: to hold a reception; to offer hospitality; to entertain (guests); to serve (customers)

招待員.definition: service personnel: usher, waiter, receptionist, hostess etc

招徠.definition: to canvass (for customers); to solicit; to recruit

招惹.definition: to court (trouble); to attract (attention); to provoke (sb)

招投標.definition: bid inviting and bid offering; bidding; auction

招接.definition: to receive (guests, clients); to interact socially with

招搖.definition: to rock back and forth; (fig.) to act ostentatiously; to brag; to show off

招搖撞騙.definition: (idiom) to dupe people by passing oneself off as a well-connected individual or a figure of authority

招搖過市.definition: (idiom) to parade oneself ostentatiously about town

招撫.definition: to enlist enemy or rebel soldiers by offering amnesty; to bring to negotiated surrender

招數.definition: move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts); gambit; trick; scheme; movement; same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]

招架.definition: to resist; to ward off; to hold one's own

招牌.definition: signboard; shop sign; reputation of a business

招牌菜.definition: signature dish; a restaurant’s most famous dish

招生.definition: to enroll new students; to get students

招租.definition: (of a house or room) to be for rent

招考.definition: to advertise an entrance examination for an academic institution (old)

招聘.definition: to invite applications for a job; to recruit

招致.definition: to recruit (followers); to scout for (talent etc); to incur; to lead to

招蜂引蝶.definition: lit. (of a flower) to attract bees and butterflies (idiom); fig. to flirt

招親.definition: to invite the groom (who will live with the bride's family); to take a wife by one's own choice

招誘.definition: to invite; to recruit; to attract; to entice

招請.definition: to recruit; to take on (an employee)

招財.definition: lit. inviting wealth; We wish you success and riches (cf idiom 招財進寶|招财进宝[zhao1 cai2 jin4 bao3])

招財貓.definition: maneki-neko or "lucky cat", Japanese figurine cat usually found at the entrance of shops, restaurants etc, believed to bring good fortune

招財進寶.definition: ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!

招賢納士.definition: invite the talented and call the valorous (idiom); to recruit talent

招贅.definition: to have the groom move into the bride's house after marriage

招遠.definition: Zhaoyuan, county-level city in Yantai 煙台|烟台[Yan1 tai2], Shandong

招遠市.definition: Zhaoyuan, county-level city in Yantai 煙台|烟台[Yan1 tai2], Shandong

招降納叛.definition: to recruit surrendered enemy and deserters (idiom); to gather together a gang of villains

招集.definition: to call on (people) to gather; to convene

招領.definition: to advertise for the owner of lost property

招風.definition: to catch the wind; (fig.) to attract criticism because of one's prominence

招風惹雨.definition: see 招風惹草|招风惹草[zhao1feng1-re3cao3]

招風攬火.definition: see 招風惹草|招风惹草[zhao1feng1-re3cao3]

招魂.definition: to call back the soul of sb who has died or is seriously ill; (fig.) to resurrect (an old system etc)
